title: Trump to WH Press Corps: The Public Doesn't Believe You People Anymore
text:
Trump to WH Press Corps: The Public Doesn't Believe You People Anymore | Posted By Tim Hains On Date February 16, 2017 
During a vigorous back-and-forth with CNN's Jim Acosta on Thursday, the president said that he was not undermining confidence in the news media because the public had none. "I know when I should get good [coverage] and when I should get bad," Trump said. "Sometimes I'll say: 'Wow, that's going to be a great story.' And I'll get killed. I know what's good and bad, I'd be a pretty good reporter, not as good as you." "But I know what is good. I know what's bad. And when they change it and make something that should be positive really bad... Because I am there. I know what was said. I know who is saying it. I am there." He added: "I want to see an honest press. It is so important to the public... The public doesn't believe you people anymore. Maybe I had something to do with that. I don't know. But they don't believe you. If you played it straight and really told it like it is... I would be your biggest fan in the world, including bad stories about me." "But CNN is story after story after story, is bad" he continued. "I won!" Related Videos
